item.title: Is Jurassic World Evolution 3 Coming to Xbox Game Pass?
item.content:encoded:
Jurassic World Evolution is roaring onto the scene and, if you fancy yourself as being better at managing prehistoric dinosaurs than John Hammond, it’s the perfect game for you—and we’ve got the details on the Game Pass status.

Releasing October 21, Jurassic World Evolution 3 makes it a trilogy for Frontier Developments, with major additions being the introduction of baby dinosaurs and modular building—two features that have starred in sister titles Planet Coaster and Planet Zoo.

With the title landing in a packed release schedule for games, it’s understandable to wonder if a Game Pass subscription can save you some cash, and we’ve got all the details on whether it’s being added to the service.

Can You Play Jurassic World Evolution 3 on Xbox Game Pass?

No, Jurassic World Evolution 3 will not be available to play with an Xbox Game Pass subscription when the title releases on October 21.

Although we’re yet to see a full reveal of the titles coming to Game Pass in October, with the first wave of releases not covering the entire month, Jurassic World Evolution 3 is not expected to be among the other additions coming later this month.

Jurassic World Evolution 3 is not a first-party Xbox title, which would have resulted in automatic inclusion in the service, so any announcement of the title featuring in the catalog would have come well in advance.

Will Jurassic World Evolution 3 Come to Xbox Game Pass?

There is no news about Jurassic World Evolution 3 coming to Xbox Game Pass in the future, although history suggests it’s likely to occur at some point.

Jurassic World Evolution 2 is currently available on the service, having featured several times in the past, while the original game has also had extended spells in the subscription service.

Other Frontier Development titles, including Planet Coaster, have also appeared on the service in the past. However, Planet Zoo and Planet Coaster 2 are yet to appear on the service, and it’s likely they would make an appearance first before Jurassic World Evolution 3—although that’s not guaranteed.

If we are to see Jurassic World Evolution 3 join the playlist, it will likely be a fairly decent period of time in the future.

What are you most excited to see in Jurassic World Evolution 3? Let us know in the Insider Gaming forum.

For more Game Pass, find out if Powerwash Simulator 2 is joining the service, and read about the addition of Fortnite Crew for Ultimate subscribers.

item.title: Xbox Game Pass Games For October 2025 Wave 1 Announced
item.content:encoded:
Microsoft has announced the next batch of games coming to Xbox Game Pass in October as part of Wave 1 for the month. This upcoming wave features 13 games, with one being available as early as today (October 8).

The first title available this month is Supermarket Simulator for Game Pass Ultimate, Premium, and PC subscribers on cloud, console, and PC. But that’s not the only new game being offered as October’s first wave includes three day-one releases, among others.

Wave 1 Xbox Game Pass Games For October

After Supermarket Simulator comes Baldur’s Gate and Baldur’s Gate II: Enhanced Editions on PC for Ultimate, Premium, and PC members on October 9. October 14 sees The Casting of Frank Stone available for the same tiers on PC, cloud, and Xbox Series X|S.

October 15 has five game additions, including a day-one launch for Ball x Pit. The games coming on the 15th are:

  • Ball x Pit (Game Pass Ultimate and PC Game Pass for cloud, console, and PC)
  • The Grinch: Christmas Adventures (Ultimate, Premium, and PC for cloud, console, and PC)
  • Eternal Strands (Premium for cloud, PC, and Xbox Series X|S)
  • He Is Coming (Premium for PC)
  • Ninja Gaiden 2 Black (Premium for cloud, PC, and Xbox Series X|S)

On October 16, Pax Dei will be available on PC for Ultimate, Premium, and PC subscribers, while the next day-one title comes on October 17 with Double Fine’s Keeper for cloud, PC, and Xbox Series X|S. Keeper is available for Ultimate and PC members.

The last two games launch on October 21 for the service. The first is Evil West on cloud, console, and PC for all subscribers of Premium, Ultimate, and PC. And, finally, the big addition of the wave is Ninja Gaiden 4, available for Ultimate and PC members only.

Other Game Pass Additions

In addition to the new games for the service, Game Pass members will receive a few other benefits. You can check those out for yourself below:

  • Dead by Daylight: Sinister Grace – Available now
  • Diablo IV: Season of Infernal Chaos – Available now
  • FBC: Firebreak – Breakpoint Update – Available now
  • Grounded 2: Hairy and Scary Update – Available now
  • Valorant: Play the new Agent Veto (Console and PC) – Available now
  • Age of Empires II: DE – Chronicles: Alexander the Great – October 14
  • Call of Duty: Warzone – Game Pass Pack 4 (Cloud, Console, and PC) – October 15

What do you think of the new games coming to Xbox Game Pass for Wave 1 in October? Leave your thoughts down in the comments below, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming, check out what games were the best-selling titles for August 2025. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.
